meanings.sent1: She enjoys whiling away the afternoon by reading in the park.
meanings.sent2: I like whiling the hours by listening to music.
meanings.sent3: While whiling the day, she discovered a new hobby.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the waves whiling the time away was soothing.
meanings.sent5: Whiling the time with laughter makes the day brighter.

meanings.definition: To spend time idly or pleasantly.
meanings.sent1: He was whiling the evening away by watching movies.
meanings.sent2: They were whiling the weekend by exploring the city.
meanings.sent3: Whiling the holiday, they found a hidden gem of a restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the music was whiling the time away effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Whiling the day in nature always brings peace to the mind.

meanings.definition: To cause time to pass idly or pleasantly.
meanings.sent1: The captivating book was whiling the hours away for her.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful scenery was whiling the time for the tourists.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks were whiling the time for the audience.
meanings.sent4: The cheerful music was whiling the time away at the party.
meanings.sent5: Whiling the evening with friends is always a good idea.
